priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Trial Summary Parameter Long Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C67152

self.title: CDISC SDTM Trial Summary Parameter Long Name Terminology

definition: The test name for an individual characteristic of a clinical trial, e.g. description of trial design, trial blinding schema, and primary objective of trial.
name: Trial Summary Parameter Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Trial Summary Parameter Long Name Terminology

terms.definition: Actual number of subjects enrolled; may include subjects who were not randomized.

Indicate if the study includes a prospectively planned opportunity for modification of one or more specified aspects of the study design and hypotheses based on analysis of data (usually interim data) from subjects in the study.
The addition of a therapeutic product to the existing regimen in a clinical trial, where both entities remain as discrete products.
terms.preferredTerm: Test Product Added to Existing Treatment

terms.definition: A textual description as to whether a biospecimen is retained and/or contains DNA.
terms.preferredTerm: Biospecimen Retained and/or Contains DNA Indicator

terms.definition: A bibliographical reference related to a particular study.
An entity that is responsible for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study.
The state or condition of the sponsor as pertains to whether the sponsor is considered a commercial entity.
A therapeutically active agent that is intended to provide reference measurements for the experimental protocol of a clinical trial.
The protocol specified minimum amount of time needed to meet the definition of a confirmed response to treatment.
Comparator against which the study treatment is evaluated (e.g., concurrent (placebo, no treatment, dose-response, active), external (historical, published literature).
The name of the country within which the final product under study is produced.
The literal identifier of the therapy or medication that is currently being given per protocol.
A date which indicates any data collected by this date will be used for analysis.
Text that describes the cutoff date.
An indication as to whether the clinical trial has an appointed data monitoring committee.

A grouping of individuals on the basis of a shared procedure or disease, or lack thereof (e.g. healthy volunteers, type 2 diabetic subjects, subjects with renal cell cancer). Standardized naming systems are available that define the groups within which a subject should be placed. (NCI)
A standard from which a judgment concerning a medical diagnosis can be established.
The unit of measure for the dosage form.
The amount of drug administered to a patient or test subject at one time or the total quantity administered. [AMA Manual of Style] (CDISC Glossary)
The number of doses administered per a specific interval.
Indicates whether the 10-second ECGs for this study were extracted from a continuous recording.
The ECG lead which was planned to be used for ECG interval measurements for this study.
terms.preferredTerm: ECG Planned Primary Lead for Study

terms.definition: The degree of automation involved in assessing the ECGs for this study.
terms.preferredTerm: ECG Read Method Degree of Automation

terms.definition: Indicates whether assessors of ECGs for this study were blinded to subject identity, timing and treatment.
Indicates whether this study includes replicate ECGs for time points during the on-treatment portion of the study.
Indicates whether this study includes replicate ECGs for time points during the baseline portion of the study.
The algorithm used to identify the end of the T wave for ECGs for this study.
Indicates whether all ECG interval measurements for the study were based on the same lead.
An alphanumeric code assigned by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) to an EMA regulatory decision for a pediatric investigation plan (PIP).
terms.preferredTerm: EMA Decision Number for Pediatric Investigation Plan

terms.definition: The Email address to which copies of the XML format of the EudraCT application should be sent.
terms.preferredTerm: E-mail Address for XML File Feedback

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the trial being submitted to the EudraCT is a trial that has been previously submitted to the EudraCT system.
A unique identifier assigned to the organization that is transmitting an adverse drug reaction report to the EudraVigilance system.
The name of the group or institution that is transmitting an adverse drug reaction report to the EudraVigilance system.
The unique alphanumeric identifier for the study with associated expanded access record, as assigned by the clinicaltrials.gov protocol registration and results system (PRS).
terms.preferredTerm: Clinicaltrials.gov NCT Number for the Expanded Access Record

terms.definition: Status indicating availability of an experimental drug or device outside any clinical trial protocol. (clinicaltrials.gov)
Exploratory measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are exploratory of the study.
An indication as to whether the study involves an FDA-regulated device.
An indication as to whether the study involves an FDA-regulated drug.
Indicate if persons who have not had the condition(s) being studied or otherwise related conditions or symptoms, as specified in the eligibility requirements, may participate in the study.
The trial design developed to compare treatment groups.
The kind of product or procedure studied in a trial.
The investigational product under study.
An indication as to whether the clinical study is being conducted at multiple sites within the European Union member state concerned by the application.
terms.preferredTerm: Multiple Site European Union State Trial Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Multiple Site EU State Trial Indicator
synonyms: Multiple Site EU State Trial Indicator

terms.definition: The number of groups or cohorts that are part of the study.
The total number of trial sites within the European Union member state concerned by the application.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Trial Sites within European Union State
terms.submissionValue: Number of Trial Sites EU State
synonyms: Number of Trial Sites EU State

terms.definition: A description of the population from which the groups or cohorts will be selected within an observational study.
A textual description of the sampling method used to assign study participants into groups or cohorts within an observational study.
The trial design developed to compare biomedical and/or health outcomes in pre-defined and non-assigned groups of individuals.
The sampling method used to assign study participants into groups or cohorts within an observational study.
The temporal relationship between the observation period and time of subject enrollment. (ClinicalTrials.gov)
An indication as to whether the trial is part of a pediatric investigation plan (PIP).
An indication as to whether the study is a pediatric postmarket study.
An indication as to whether the study is a pediatric study.
The pharmacological class of the investigational product.
The country name of planned study facility which has received IRB approval.
The anticipated maximum age of the subjects to be entered in a clinical trial. (NCI)
The anticipated minimum age of the subjects to be entered in a clinical trial. (NCI)
The planned number of intervention groups.
The planned number of subjects to be entered in a clinical trial. (NCI)
The approximate period of time over which the clinical trial is expected to occur.

The primary measurement(s) or observation(s) used to measure the effect of experimental variables in a study, or for observational studies, to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment. These are the outcome measures used to assess the primary objective(s).
A word or small set of words designed to convey the focus of the protocol.
A globally unique identifier for a biomedical article, as assigned by PubMed.
terms.preferredTerm: PubMed Identifier for Citation Used in Study
terms.submissionValue: PubMed ID for Citation Used in Study
synonyms: PubMed ID for Citation Used in Study

terms.definition: The randomization quotient is the number of planned subjects to be exposed to investigational therapy, independent of dose or other factors, divided by the total number of planned subjects.
An indication as to whether the condition under study is considered a rare disease.
Identification numbers assigned to the protocol by clinicaltrials.gov, EudraCT, or other registries.
A standard from which a judgment concerning a disease relapse can be established.
An indication as to whether the registrant would like to receive an XML copy of their study as saved on EudraCT.
terms.submissionValue: Request for XML Copy of Study Indicator
synonyms: Request for XML Copy of Study Indicator

terms.definition: An alphabetic character that describes the incremental order of trial resubmissions.
A textual description of the specimen types that are retained as reserve samples.
The course by which a substance was administered in order to reach the site of action in the body.
An indication as to whether suspected unexpected serious adverse reactions (SUSAR) will be reported to a EudraVigiliance clinical trial module (EVCTM).
terms.preferredTerm: SUSAR Reporting to EudraVigiliance Clinical Trial Module Indicator

terms.definition: An indication as to whether suspected unexpected serious adverse reactions (SUSAR) will be reported to national competent authorities (NCA).
terms.preferredTerm: SUSAR Reporting to National Competent Authority Indicator

terms.definition: Other key measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are a focus of the study. These are the outcome measures used to assess the secondary objective(s).
An indication as to whether the XML copy of the EudraCT application requires secure E-mail delivery.
terms.preferredTerm: Requires Secure Email Delivery of XML Indicator

terms.definition: A standard from which a judgment concerning the severity of an event, disease or condition can be established.
The specific sex, either male, female, or mixed of the subject group being studied. (NCI)
An indication as to whether the clinical study is being conducted at only one site within the European Union member state concerned by the application.
terms.preferredTerm: Single Site European Union State Trial Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Single Site EU State Trial Indicator
synonyms: Single Site EU State Trial Indicator

terms.definition: The protocol specified minimum amount of time needed to meet the definition of stable disease.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.
Final date on which data was collected for any subject (Date/Time of End of Participation, RFPENDTC) based on the protocol.

The earliest date of informed consent among any subject (Date/Time of Informed Consent, RFICDTC) that enrolled in the study. For studies conducted without informed consent (ie. emergency use) use the date of treatment. Dates for subjects who were screen failures are not included.
The rule, regulation and/or condition that determines the point in time when a clinical trial will be terminated. (NCI)
Describes the role the study plays in determining the interventions a subject receives.
A textual description of the substudy.
An indication as to whether a study performed on a subgroup of subjects included in the original trial (substudy) is planned for the current study.
The anticipated time period over which each study participant is to be followed. (ClinicalTrials.gov)

A knowledge field that focuses on research and development of specific treatments for diseases and pathologic findings, as well as prevention of conditions that negatively impact the health of an individual. (NCI)
The name of a code list that contains terms to define the type of blinding for the trial. (NCI)
The condition, disease or disorder that the clinical trial is intended to investigate or address.
The name of a code list that contains terms to define the type of trial, e.g. cure or prevention. (NCI)
Planned length of observation for a single subject.

Clinical trials are broken into three or four phases: Phase I tests a new drug or treatment for safety in a small group; Phase II expands the study to a larger group of people; Phase III expands the study to an even larger group of people to measure whether the treatment actually benefits patients, and whether its benefits exceed its risks; and Phase IV takes place after the drug or treatment has been licensed and marketed. (NCI)
The principal purpose of the trial.
The auxiliary purpose of the trial.
The name of a clinical trial. (NCI)
The type of clinical trial performed e.g. efficacy, safety. (NCI)

The process of assigning trial subjects to treatment or control groups using an element of chance to determine the assignments in order to reduce bias. NOTE: Unequal randomization is used to allocate subjects into groups at a differential rate; for example, three subjects may be assigned to a treatment group for every one assigned to the control group. [ICH E6 1.48] See also balanced study. (CDISC glossary)
The uniform resource locator (URL) related to a particular study.
A textual description of the uniform resource locator (URL) related to a particular study.
terms.preferredTerm: Study Protocol Uniform Resource Locator Description
